ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a way to quickly insert frequently used commands into the terminal using shortcuts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Command expansion on empty enter press â€¢ Customizable command shortcuts using a module directory â€¢ Zsh support
ðŸ“– Summary: The Empty Enter Expander is a tool designed to reduce typing in the terminal by allowing users to define shortcuts for commands. It works by expanding a command into the prompt when Enter is pressed on an empty line, then allowing the user to type a sequence of characters that map to a pre-defined command. It currently supports Zsh and uses a module directory to store the command definitions.
